name: Artificial structures and inputs
functionStatement: Integrates the range of "typical" flows experienced by other processes. Examines the degree to which upstream infrastructure or land uses have fundamentally altered flow regimes (e.g., hydropeaking, dams, withdrawals).
descriptionMarkdown: Documents dams, weirs, levees, diversions, pumps, and returns that alter hydrograph timing, peaks, baseflow, or floodplain access.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Map regulating structures and inputs in the reach and upstream area; record type, size, proximity, and operations; note large wastewater returns. Use NID, NLD, FERC, state dam lists, and local agencies; where flow data exist, review IHA departures.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Multiple or large structures strongly regulate or dewater.
Criteria: Flattened peaks, daily stage swings, or widespread IHA departures.

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: One or two moderate structures or diversions noticeably alter flows.
Criteria: Reduced floodplain access, altered baseflow, or shifted seasonal timing.

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: One small structure or minor diversion with limited local effects.
Criteria: Localized regulation or slight departures in IHA components.

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: No major regulating structures or inputs affecting the reach.
Criteria: No dams, levees, or diversions; IHA components generally within reference.
